mission.title: Our Mission
mission.statement: HackBU is a student-led community at Boston University dedicated to building tools and systems that improve campus life. We're not just learning to code â€” we're solving real problems for real students, staff, and faculty. Through bounties, projects, and collaborative events, we help students find passion, build skills, form community, and make meaningful impact.

sponsors.name: BU Spark!
sponsors.description: BU Spark! empowers students to learn experientially through real-world tech projects. As our primary sponsor, Spark! provides mentorship, resources, and the creative energy that makes HackBU possible.

sponsors.name: BU Information Services & Technology
sponsors.description: BU IS&T provides the infrastructure, API access, and technical guidance that enables HackBU projects to integrate with real campus systems. Their support turns student ideas into production-ready tools.

whatWeDo.title: Bounties
whatWeDo.description: Tackle real coding challenges with cash prizes. From API integrations to UI improvements, bounties let you contribute to campus tech while earning recognition and rewards.

whatWeDo.title: Projects
whatWeDo.description: Browse student-built tools serving the BU community. Join an existing project or propose your own. All projects are open source and built collaboratively.

whatWeDo.title: Events
whatWeDo.description: Join us for Syntax & Snax (casual coding sessions), Code & Tell (demo nights), hackathons, and our live streaming show where we build and learn together.

steps.title: Join Our Discord
steps.description: Connect with the community, ask questions, and find collaborators. Our Discord is the hub for all HackBU activity.

steps.title: Explore & Pick a Track
steps.description: Browse bounties and projects. Whether you're into Web, Data, Infrastructure, or UX â€” there's a place for you.

steps.title: Start Building
steps.description: Claim your first bounty, join a project team, or attend a Code & Tell. Learning happens by doing.

steps.title: Level Up
steps.description: Earn points, unlock badges, and climb the leaderboard. Help others, mentor newcomers, and grow the community.

team.name: BU Spark! Staff
team.description: Spark! staff provide strategic direction, mentorship, and program support.

team.name: Student Maintainers
team.description: Experienced student developers who review PRs, mentor newcomers, and maintain core projects.

team.name: IS&T Advisors
team.description: IS&T representatives provide API access, security guidance, and infrastructure support.

faq.question: Who can join HackBU?
faq.answer: Any BU student! No prior coding experience required. We welcome all skill levels and help you learn as you go.

faq.question: What's the time commitment?
faq.answer: Totally flexible. Work on bounties at your own pace, join events when you can, or dive deep into a semester-long project. You decide.

faq.question: How do bounties and prizes work?
faq.answer: Bounties are posted with clear requirements and prize amounts. Submit your work, get it reviewed, and if approved, you earn the prize and leaderboard points.

faq.question: Who owns the code I write?
faq.answer: All HackBU projects are open source (typically MIT license). You maintain credit and can showcase your work. BU may use projects that integrate with campus systems.

faq.question: Can I propose my own project?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Pitch your idea in Discord, gather a team, and if it aligns with HackBU's mission, we'll help you build it.

faq.question: What if I need help or get stuck?
faq.answer: Ask in Discord! Student maintainers and Spark! mentors are active and eager to help. We also host office hours and pair programming sessions.

codeOfConduct.title: Code of Conduct
codeOfConduct.summary: HackBU is committed to providing a welcoming, safe, and inclusive environment for all participants. We do not tolerate harassment, discrimination, or disrespectful behavior of any kind.
codeOfConduct.reporting: To report a concern or incident, contact BU Spark! staff directly via Discord DM or email spark@bu.edu. All reports are handled confidentially.
codeOfConduct.moderation: Violations may result in removal from the community, loss of bounty eligibility, or referral to BU Student Affairs.
